etymology.description: 热(熱) (rè, "heat") is simplified from 熱(熱) (rè, "heat") with 埶(埶) (yì, "skill") replaced by 执(执) (zhí, "to hold") for phonetic representation
etymology.interpretation: 热(熱) (rè, "heat") was simplified by replacing 埶(埶) (yì, "skill") with 执(执) (zhí, "to hold"), which served as a simpler phonetic element while maintaining the original meaning related to heat.
etymology.simplification: 热(熱) (rè, "heat") was simplified by substituting 埶(埶) (yì, "skill") with 执(执) (zhí, "to hold"), allowing for a more straightforward script while preserving the phonetic similarity.

examples.chinese: 夏天太热了(夏天太熱了)。
examples.english: It is too hot in summer.

examples.chinese: 厨房里的火炉热得冒烟(廚房裡的火爐熱得冒煙)，空气也变得闷热(空氣也變得悶熱)。
examples.pinyin: Chúfáng lǐ de huǒlú rè de mào yān, kōngqì yě biàn de mèn rè.
examples.english: The stove in the kitchen is so hot that it emits smoke, and the air becomes stuffy.
